judyle.comment:
After reviewing the discussion, I believe prioritizing special education funding is the right choice.
It addresses a long-standing need and supports equity in our schools.

katrinacallsen.comment: I voted yes because while I do have concerns about the specific details around timing and who needs to sign off on certain aspects of this project, I also recognize that there is a lot of momentum behind this effort. The students deserve better science labs and improved facilities. It seems like a worthwhile investment in our future generations.

grahampaige.comment: OK, thank you very much for those votes.  And since there were no objections to the motion, I'll declare that the motion passes unanimously.
